sentences.en: A wedding is a joyful celebration of love.
sentences.cn: 婚礼就是快乐的爱情庆典。

sentences.en: Another celebration had drawn to its close.
He asked Ginny if she would consent to a small celebration after the christening.
sentences.cn: 他问金尼是否同意在洗礼之后小小地庆祝一下。

sentences.en: He sees the poem as a celebration of human love.
sentences.cn: 他认为，这首诗是对人世间爱的赞美。

sentences.en: Her triumph was a cause for celebration .
sentences.cn: 她的胜利是庆祝的理由。

sentences.en: I can tell you, there was a celebration in our house that night.
sentences.cn: 跟你说吧，那天晚上我们在家里搞了个庆祝活动。

sentences.en: In the event ( that ) our team wins, there will be a celebration.
sentences.cn: 如果我队获胜, 我们将庆祝一番.

sentences.en: Sing up , fellows, this is supposed to be a celebration, not a funeral!
sentences.cn: 伙计们,大声唱, 这是开庆祝会, 不是送葬!

sentences.en: Some higher officials attended the celebration rally.
sentences.cn: 一些高级官员参加了庆祝大会.

sentences.en: The celebration meeting was held with great enthusiasm.
The Conference will be a celebration of women's achievements.
sentences.cn: 该会议将成为对女性成就的一曲赞歌。

sentences.en: the lively New Year celebrations in the city centre
sentences.cn: 市中心热闹的新年庆祝活动

sentences.en: The National - Day celebration this year was an unprecedentedly great occasion.
sentences.cn: 今年国庆日庆祝仪式空前盛大.

sentences.en: The streets were illuminated for the celebration.
sentences.cn: 街上张灯结彩准备庆祝.

sentences.en: Then it was back to the house for a quiet celebration.
sentences.cn: 然后就回到房子里悄悄地庆祝一番。
他们举行了一次庆祝大会.

sentences.en: This was not a memorial service but a celebration of his life.
sentences.cn: 这不是在开追悼会，而是在颂扬他的一生。

words.tran_cn: 司仪神父；主持仪式的人；主持弥撒的教父
庆祝（celebrate的过去式和过去分词）
庆祝；过节；举行宗教仪式

trans.tran_en: an occasion or party when you celebrate something
